alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 12:10PM CST until December 31 at 4:48AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Recent rainfall due to a large area of low pressure with accompanying above normal seasonal temperatures resulted in up to around 2 inches of liquid precipitation falling in the southern Red River Basin. The rain fell on mostly frozen ground allowing the water to run off into into the mainstem Red River. Addition flows moving north on the Bois de Sioux near Lake Traverse are also contributing to the river rises. Therefore, the forecast is for Wahpeton, Fargo and Abercrombie to reach minor flood stage. For the Red River...including Wahpeton and Fargo...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wild Rice River (ND)...including Abercrombie...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to 21.0 feet Thursday afternoon. It will then slowly fall early Friday morning and then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Wednesday evening at 615 PM CST.
